Flashcard Forge
- Single-file Python 3 script using ONLY standard library (json, os, datetime, hashlib, urllib.parse, webbrowser, sys).
- Command-line flashcard app for learning: create decks with terms/questions and definitions/answers.
- Core loop: main menu with options - 1) Add card (prompt for deck name, term, definition), 2) Study session (select deck, quiz mode: show term hide answer or vice versa), 3) List decks/cards, 4) Delete card/deck, 5) Export deck to JSON, 6) Import from JSON, 7) Share deck (generate shareable hash URL), 8) Quit.
- Data persistence: store all decks in 'flashcards.json' as dict {deck_name: [{term: str, definition: str, added: ISO datetime}]}; auto-save on changes, load on start.
- Study mode: random shuffle cards using random.shuffle; show term/definition with spacebar to flip (use input("Press Enter to flip...")), track correct/incorrect streak, session stats (cards reviewed, accuracy %).
- Export/Import: write/read JSON files via file dialog (use input paths); validate JSON structure on import.
- Share feature: compute deck hash with hashlib.sha256(deck_data.encode()).hexdigest()[:8]; print "Share URL: file://<script_path>?deck=<hash>" - on launch, parse sys.argv[1:] or input for ?deck=hash to auto-load that deck for study.
- Keyboard-friendly CLI: clear screen with os.system('cls' if os.name=='nt' else 'clear'); color output using ANSI escapes (\033[92m green, etc.); arrow-key simulation via single-char input with getch-like (use sys.stdin.read(1)).
- Stats: track per-deck mastery (correct/total attempts, stored in card dict); sort study by lowest mastery first.
- Edge cases: handle empty decks, duplicate terms, JSON corruption (backup on load), Unicode terms.
- Usage: python flashcard_forge.py [?deck=abc123] - runs in <800 lines, testable with sample decks on first run.
